translated: Having entered Rahu's mouth, why does the moon not rise again?

original: dhigdhik śarīrasukhalālitamānaveṣu mā khedayeddhanakṛśaṃ hi śarīrameva /
analyzed: dhik dhik śarīra sukha lālita mānaveṣu mā khedayet dhana kṛśam hi śarīram eva
translated: Fie, fie on those who pamper their bodies with pleasures! Let not the king distress his body, already emaciated by charity.

original: saddārakā hyadhanapāṇḍusutāḥ śrutā hi duḥkhaṃ vihāya punareva sukhaṃ prapannāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sat dārakāḥ hi adhana pāṇḍu sutāḥ śrutāḥ hi duḥkham vihāya punar eva sukham prapannāḥ
translated: The good sons of Pandu, though poor, have been heard to have attained happiness again after overcoming sorrow.

analyzed: gandharva vidyām ālokya vādyam ca gaṇikā gaṇān
translated: Having studied the science of Gandharvas, music, and the arts of courtesans,

analyzed: dhanurveda artha śāstrāṇi loke rakṣet ca bhūpatiḥ
translated: the king should protect the world through the knowledge of archery and the scriptures.

original: kāraṇena vinā bhṛtye yastu kupyati pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: kāraṇena vinā bhṛtye yaḥ tu kupyati pārthivaḥ
translated: The king who becomes angry with his servants without reason,

analyzed: sa gṛhṇāti viṣa unmādam kṛṣṇasarpa visarjitam
translated: he contracts the madness of poison released by a black serpent.

analyzed: cāpalāt vārayet dṛṣṭim mithyā vākyam ca vārayet
translated: He should restrain his glance from fickleness and false speech,

original: mānave śrotriye caiva bhṛtyavarge sadaiva hi // / / //
analyzed: mānave śrotriye ca eva bhṛtya varge sadā eva hi
translated: always towards the learned, the Brahmins, and the class of servants.

analyzed: līlām karoti yaḥ rājā bhṛtya sva jana garvitaḥ
translated: The king who indulges in sports, proud of his servants and relatives,

analyzed: śāsane sarvadā kṣipram ripubhiḥ paribhūyate
translated: is quickly overpowered by enemies in his kingdom at all times.

original: huṅkāre bhṛkuṭīṃ naiva sadā kurvīta pārthivaḥ /🔽vinā doṣeṇa yo bhṛtyānrājādhamaṇa śāsti ca /🔽līlāsukhāni bhogyāni tyajediha mahīpatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: huṅkāre bhṛkuṭīm nā eva sadā kurvīta pārthivaḥ  vinā doṣeṇa yaḥ bhṛtyān rāja adhamaṇa śāsti ca  līlā sukhāni bhogyāni tyajet iha mahīpatiḥ
translated: The king should never frown or make a humming sound.🔽The king who punishes servants without fault,🔽the lord of the earth should abandon the pleasures and enjoyments of sports here.

analyzed: sukha pravṛttaiḥ śatravaḥ vigrahe sthitaiḥ
translated: Enemies are subdued by those engaged in well-being, standing in conflict.

analyzed: udyogaḥ sāhasam dhairyam buddhiḥ śaktiḥ parākramaḥ
translated: Exertion, courage, patience, intellect, strength, and valor -

analyzed: ṣaḍvidhaḥ yasya utsāhaḥ tasya śaṅkate
translated: he who has these six kinds of enthusiasm, even the gods fear him.

original: udyogena kṛte kārye siddharyasya na vidyate /
analyzed: udyogena kṛte kārye siddhar yasya na vidyate
translated: If success is not obtained despite making efforts,

original: daivaṃ tasya pramāṇaṃ hi kartavyaṃ pauruṣaṃ sadā // / / //
analyzed: daivam tasya pramāṇam hi kartavyam pauruṣam sadā
translated: destiny is the criterion for him, but one should always exert.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe pūrvakhaṇḍe prathamāṃśākhye ācārakāṇḍe bṛhadṛ nītisāre ekādaśottaraśatatamo 'dhyāyaḥ🔽śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam🔽sūta uvāca /🔽bhṛtyā bahuvidhā jñeyā uttamādhamamadhyamāḥ /
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe pūrva khaṇḍe prathama aṃśa ākhye ācāra kāṇḍe nīti sāre ekādaśottaraśatatamaḥ dhyāyaḥ 🔽śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam 🔽sūtaḥ uvāca 🔽bhṛtyāḥ bahuvidhāḥ jñeyāḥ uttama adhama madhyamāḥ
translated: Thus ends the one hundred and eleventh chapter in the First Part of the Ācāra Kanda of the Skanda Mahāpurāṇa.

analyzed: niyoktavyāḥ yathārheṣu trividheṣu eva karmasu
translated: Should be employed in the three kinds of duties, according to their fitness.

original: bhṛtye parikṣaṇaṃ vakṣye yasyayasya hi yo guṇaḥ /
analyzed: bhṛtye pari kṣaṇam vakṣye yasya yasya hi yaḥ guṇaḥ
translated: I shall describe the examination of servants, as to whose what quality is.

analyzed: tam imam saṃpravakṣyāmi ye yathā kathitam kila
translated: I shall declare this, as it is said, according to each one.

analyzed: yathā caturbhiḥ kanakam parīkṣyate nigharṣaṇa chedana tāpa tāḍanaiḥ
translated: Just as gold is tested by four methods - rubbing, cutting, heating and hammering,

original: tathā caturbhirbhṛtakaṃ parīkṣayedvatena śīlena kalena karmaṇā // / / //🔽kulaśīlaguṇopetaḥ satyadharmaparāyaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tathā caturbhiḥ bhṛtakam śīlena kalena karmaṇā  kula śīla guṇa upetaḥ satya dharma parāyaṇaḥ
translated: In the same way, a servant is tested by four things - by his conduct, character, age and work.🔽One endowed with good family, character and qualities, devoted to truth and dharma,

analyzed: rūpavān su prasannaḥ ca kośa adhyakṣaḥ vidhīyate
translated: Handsome and cheerful, is appointed as the treasurer.

analyzed: mūlya rūpa parīkṣā kṛt bhave dratna parīkṣakaḥ
translated: The examiner of gems, who tests the value and form of gems,

analyzed: balābala parijñātā senā adhyakṣaḥ vidhīyate
translated: Is appointed as the commander-in-chief, who knows the strength and weakness of the army.

analyzed: iṅgita ākāra tattva jñaḥ balavān priya darśanaḥ
translated: One who knows the truth of gestures and expressions, strong, pleasant to look at,

original: apramādī pramāthī ca pratīhāraḥ sa ucyate // / / //
analyzed: apramādī pramāthī ca pratīhāraḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: Not negligent, and a conqueror, is said to be the doorkeeper.

analyzed: medhāvī vāc paṭuḥ prājñaḥ satya vādī jita indriyaḥ
translated: Intelligent, eloquent, wise, truthful, self-controlled,

analyzed: sarva śāstra samālokī hi eṣa sādhuḥ sa lekhakaḥ
translated: This good man, who has studied all the scriptures, is the scribe.

analyzed: buddhimān matimān ca eva para citta upalakṣakaḥ
translated: He should be intelligent, wise, able to understand the thoughts of others,

original: krūro yathoktavādī ca eṣa dūto vidhīyate // / / //
analyzed: krūraḥ yathā ukta vādī ca eṣa dūtaḥ vidhīyate
translated: and speak as he is told. Such a person is appointed as a messenger.

analyzed: samasta smṛti śāstra jñaḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: He should be knowledgeable in all Smriti scriptures, learned, self-controlled,

analyzed: śaurya vīrya guṇa upetaḥ dharma adhyakṣaḥ vidhīyate
translated: endowed with the qualities of courage and valor, and appointed as the head of justice.
He should be skilled in the duties of his ancestors, knowledgeable in the scriptures, truthful,

analyzed: śuciḥ ca kaṭhinaḥ ca eva sūpa kāraḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: pure, and firm. Such a person is called a cook.

analyzed: āyurveda kṛta abhyāsaḥ sarveṣām priya darśanaḥ
translated: He should be well-versed in Ayurveda, be pleasant to look at by all,

analyzed: āyuḥ śīla guṇa upetaḥ vaidyaḥ eva vidhīyate
translated: and possess the qualities of longevity and good conduct. Such a person is appointed as a physician.
He should be knowledgeable in the Vedas and Vedangas, devoted to japa and havana,

analyzed: āśīrvāda paraḥ nityam eṣa rāja purohita
translated: and always engaged in giving blessings. Such a person is appointed as the royal priest.

analyzed: lekhakaḥ pāṭhakaḥ ca eva gaṇakaḥ pratirodhakaḥ
translated: The writer, the reader, the accountant, the opponent,

analyzed: ālasya yuktaḥ ca edrājā karma saṃvarjayet sadā  dvi jihvam udvega karam krūram ekānta dāruṇam
translated: and the lazy king should always avoid work.🔽The tongue of a wicked person is double-tongued, causing anxiety, cruel, and extremely terrible.

analyzed: khalasya aheḥ ca vadanam apakārāya kevalam
translated: The face of a wicked person is only for the purpose of doing harm.

analyzed: durjanaḥ parihartavyaḥ vidyayā alaṅkṛtaḥ pisan
translated: Even if a bad person is adorned with learning, he should be avoided.

original: maṇinā bhūṣitaḥ sarpaḥ kimasau na bhayaṅkaraḥ // / / //🔽akāraṇaviṣkṛtakopadhāriṇaḥ khalādbhayaṃ kasya na nāma jāyate /
analyzed: maṇinā bhūṣitaḥ sarpaḥ kim asau na bhayaṅkaraḥ  akāraṇa viṣkṛta kopa dhāriṇaḥ khalāt bhayam kasya na nāma jāyate
translated: Is a snake adorned with jewels not frightening?🔽Who does not fear the wicked, who bear malice without cause?

original: viṣaṃ mahāherviṣamasya durvacaḥ saduḥ sahaṃ sannipatetsadā mukhe // / / //
analyzed: viṣam mahā aheḥ viṣamasya durvacaḥ sa duḥ saham san nipatet sadā mukhe
translated: The poison of a great snake and the evil words of a wicked person - both are unbearable and always fall into the mouth.

analyzed: tulya artham tulya sāmarthyam marma jñam vyavasāyinam
translated: A servant who is equal in wealth, equal in ability, who knows the weak points, and is determined,

original: ardharājyaharaṃ bhṛtyaṃ yo hanyātsa na hanyate // / / //
analyzed: ardha rājya haram bhṛtyam yaḥ hanyāt sa na hanyate
translated: If one kills a servant who takes half the kingdom, one is not killed.

analyzed: śūra tva yuktāḥ mṛdu manda vākyāḥ jita indriyāḥ satya parākramāḥ ca
translated: Those who are brave, who speak gently and slowly, who have conquered the senses, and who are truthful and valorous,

original: prāgeva paścādviparī tarupā ye te tu bhṛtyā na hitā bhavanti // / / //
analyzed: prāk eva paścāt viparī ye te tu bhṛtyāḥ na hitāḥ bhavanti
translated: But those who are the opposite of this in the beginning and later, they are not beneficial servants.

analyzed: nirālasyāḥ su santuṣṭāḥ pratibodhakāḥ
translated: Those who are free from laziness, who are very content, who are enlightening,

original: sukhaduḥ khasamā dhīrā bhṛtyā lokeṣu durlabhāḥ // / / //🔽kṣāntistayavihīnaśca krūrabuddhiśca nindakaḥ /
analyzed: sukha duḥ kha samāḥ dhīrāḥ bhṛtyāḥ lokeṣu durlabhāḥ  kṣāntiḥ taya vihīnaḥ ca krūra buddhiḥ ca nindakaḥ
translated: And who have equanimity in happiness and sorrow, such servants are rare in the world.🔽And one who is devoid of patience, who is cruel-minded, who is a critic,

analyzed: dāmbhikaḥ kapaṭī ca eva śaṭhaḥ ca spṛhayā anvitaḥ
translated: Who is hypocritical, deceitful, cunning, and full of desire,

original: aśakto bhayabhītaśca rājñā tyaktavya eva saḥ // / / //
analyzed: aśaktaḥ bhaya bhītaḥ ca rājñā tyaktavyaḥ eva saḥ
translated: And who is incapable and fearful, such a person should be abandoned by the king.

analyzed: su sandhānāni ca astrāṇi śastrāṇi vividhāni ca
translated: And well-constructed weapons and various implements,

analyzed: durge praveśitavyāni tatas śatrum nipātayet
translated: and then he should strike down the enemy.

analyzed: ṣaṣ māsam atha varṣam vā sandhim kuryāt narādhipaḥ
translated: The king should make peace for six months or a year,

analyzed: paśyan sañcitam ātmānam punar śatrum nipātayet
translated: seeing himself accumulated, he should again strike down the enemy.

analyzed: mūrkhān niyojayet yaḥ tu trayaḥ pi ete mahīpateḥ
translated: If one employs fools, all these three are of the king.

analyzed: ayaśaḥ ca artha nāśaḥ ca narake ca eva pātanam
translated: Disgrace, loss of wealth, and downfall into hell.

original: yatkiñcitkurute karma śubhaṃ vā yādi vāśubham /
analyzed: yat kiñcid kurute karma śubham vā yā ādi vā aśubham
translated: Whatever work, good or bad, is done,

original: tena sma vardhate rājā sūkṣmato bhṛtyakāryataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tena sma vardhate rājā sūkṣmataḥ bhṛtya kāryataḥ
translated: by that the king prospers, subtly through the work of his servants.

analyzed: tasmāt bhūmi īśvaraḥ prājñam dharma kāma artha sādhane
translated: Therefore, the wise king should always employ the wise in the accomplishment of dharma, kama and artha,

analyzed: niyoja yet hi satatam go brāhmaṇa hitāya vai
translated: for the welfare of cows and Brahmins.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe pūrvakhaṇḍe prathamāṃśākhye ācārakāṇḍe bṛhaspatyukta nītiptāre dvādaśottarakaśatatamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe pūrva khaṇḍe prathama aṃśa ākhye ācāra kāṇḍe dvādaśottarakaśatatamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the one hundred and twelfth chapter on the discourse on policy by Brihaspati in the first section of the first part of the auspicious Garudapurana.

analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: The glorious Garuda Mahapurana.

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

analyzed: guṇavantam niyuñjīta guṇa hīnam vivarjayet
translated: One should employ the virtuous and avoid the non-virtuous.

original: paṇḍitasya guṇāḥ sarve mūrve doṣāśca kevalāḥ // / / //
analyzed: paṇḍitasya guṇāḥ sarve mūrve doṣāḥ ca kevalāḥ
translated: All the qualities are of the learned and all the faults are of the fool alone.

analyzed: sadbhiḥ āsīta satatam sadbhiḥ kurvīta saṅgatim
translated: One should always associate with the virtuous, make friends with the virtuous,

analyzed: sadbhiḥ vivādam na asadbhiḥ kiñcid ācaret
translated: and have disputes and friendships with the virtuous, but do nothing with the non-virtuous.

analyzed: paṇḍitaiḥ ca virnātaiḥ ca dharmaśaiḥ satya vādibhiḥ
translated: One should live even in bondage with the wise, the learned, the righteous, and the truthful,

original: bandhstho 'pi tiṣṭhecca na tu rājye khalaiḥ saha // / / //
analyzed: tiṣṭhet ca na tu rājye khalaiḥ saha
translated: but not in a kingdom with the wicked.

analyzed: sa avaśeṣāṇi kāryāṇi kuvatra arthe yujyate
translated: One should undertake tasks with a remainder of purpose.

analyzed: tasmāt sarvāṇi kāryāṇi sa avaśeṣāṇi kārayet
translated: Therefore, all tasks should be performed with a remainder.

analyzed: madhu hā iva duhet sāram kusumam ca na ghātayet
translated: One should extract the essence like a bee, but not destroy the flower.

analyzed: vatsa apekṣī duhet kṣīram bhūmim gān ca eva pārthipaḥ
translated: The king should milk the cow and the land, considering the calf.

analyzed: yathākrameṇa puṣpebhyaḥ cinute madhu ṣaṭpadaḥ
translated: Just as a bee collects honey from flowers in sequence,

original: tathā vittamu pādāya rājā kurvīta sañcayam // / / //
analyzed: tathā vittam u pādāya rājā kurvīta sañcayam
translated: in the same way, the king should accumulate wealth after obtaining it.

analyzed: valmīkam madhu jālam ca śuklaṇkṣe tu candramāḥ
translated: An anthill, a honeycomb, the moon in the bright fortnight,

analyzed: rāja dravyam ca bhaikṣyam ca stokam stokam pravardhate
translated: the wealth of the king, and alms - increase little by little.

analyzed: arjitasya kṣayam dṛṣṭā saṃpradattasya sañcayam
translated: Having seen the destruction of what is earned and the accumulation of what is given away,

analyzed: avandhyam divasam kuryāt dāna adhyayana karmasu
translated: one should make one's day fruitful in giving, studying, and work.

original: vane 'pi doṣāḥ prabhavanti rāgiṇāṃ gṛhe 'pi pañcendriyanigrahastapaḥ /
analyzed: vane pi doṣāḥ prabhavanti rāgiṇām gṛhe pi pañca indriya nigrahaḥ tapaḥ
translated: Even in the forest, faults arise for the passionate; even in the house, self-control of the five senses is austerity.

original: akutsite karmaṇi yaḥ pravartate nivṛttarāgasya gṛhaṃ tapovanam // / / //
analyzed: akutsite karmaṇi yaḥ pravartate nivṛtta rāgasya gṛham tapaḥ vanam
translated: For one engaged in blameless action, the house of one free from attachment is a penance grove.

original: satyena rakṣyate dharmo vidyā yogena rakṣyate /
analyzed: satyena rakṣyate dharmaḥ vidyā yogena rakṣyate
translated: Dharma is protected by truth, learning is protected by yoga.

original: mṛjayā rakṣyate pātraṃ kulaṃ śalina rakṣyate // / / //
analyzed: mṛjayā rakṣyate pātram kulam śalina rakṣyate
translated: A vessel is protected by polishing, a family is protected by a virtuous daughter.

original: varaṃ vindhyāṭavyāṃ nivasanamabhuktasya maraṇaṃ varaṃ sarpākīrṇe śayanamatha kūpe nipatanam /
analyzed: varam vindhya aṭavyām nivasanam abhuktasya maraṇam varam sarpa ākīrṇe śayanam atha kūpe nipatanam
translated: Better to live in the Vindhya forest, better to die of hunger, better to sleep in a place infested with snakes, better to fall into a well,

original: varaṃ bhrāntāvarte sabhayajalamadhye praviśanaṃ na tu svīye pakṣe hi dhanamaṇu dehīti kathanam // / / //
analyzed: varam bhrānta āvarte sa bhaya jala madhye praviśanam na tu svīye pakṣe hi dhanam aṇu dehi iti kathanam
translated: Better to enter the fearful water in the middle of a whirling eddy, than to say Give me a little wealth to one's own party.

analyzed: bhāgya kṣayeṣu kṣīyante na upabhogena sampadaḥ
translated: When fortunes are exhausted, they are destroyed not by enjoyment.

original: pūrvārjite hi sukṛte na naśyanti kadācana // / / //
analyzed: pūrva arjite hi sukṛte na naśyanti kadācana
translated: For the good deeds earned in the past are never destroyed.

original: viprāṇāṃ bhūṣaṇaṃ vidyā pṛthivyā bhūṣaṇaṃ nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: viprāṇām bhūṣaṇam vidyā pṛthivyāḥ bhūṣaṇam nṛpaḥ
translated: Learning is the ornament of Brahmins, a king is the ornament of the earth,

original: nabhaso bhūṣaṇaṃ candraḥ śīlaṃ sarvasya bhūṣaṇam // / / //
analyzed: nabhasaḥ bhūṣaṇam candraḥ śīlam sarvasya bhūṣaṇam
translated: The moon is the ornament of the sky, good conduct is the ornament of all.

original: ete te candratulyāḥ kṣitipatitanayā bhīmasenārjunādyāḥ śurāḥ satyapratijñā dinakaravapuṣaḥ keśavenopagūḍhāḥ /
analyzed: ete te candra tulyāḥ kṣitipati tanayāḥ bhīmasena arjuna ādyāḥ śurāḥ satya pratijñāḥ dinakara vapuṣaḥ keśavena upagūḍhāḥ
translated: These sons of kings, Bhima, Arjuna and others, who are like the moon, who are heroes, true to their promises, who have bodies like the sun, and who are embraced by Keshava,

original: te vai duṣṭagrahasthāḥ kṛpaṇavaśagatā bhaikṣyacaryāṃ prayātāḥ ko vā kasminsamartho bhavati vidhivaśādbhrāmayetkarmarekhā // / / //
analyzed: te vai duṣṭa graha sthāḥ kṛpaṇa vaśa gatāḥ bhaikṣya caryām prayātāḥ kaḥ vā kasmin samarthaḥ bhavati vidhi vaśāt bhrāmayet karma rekhā
translated: they, being under the influence of evil planets, have become subject to misery and have gone on a begging round. Who is able to do what for whom? The course of karma whirls (everyone) around by the power of fate.

original: brahmā yena kulālavanniyamito brahmāṇḍabhāṇḍodare viṣṇuryena daśāvatāragahane kṣipto mahāsaṅkaṭe /
analyzed: brahmā yena kulāla vat niyamitaḥ brahmāṇḍa bhāṇḍa udare viṣṇuḥ yena daśa avatāra gahane kṣiptaḥ mahā saṅkaṭe
translated: By whom Brahma is controlled like a potter, in the belly of the universe; by whom Vishnu is thrown into the great danger of the dense forest of ten incarnations;

original: rudroyena kapālapāṇipuṭake bhikṣāṭanaṃ kāritaḥ sūryo bhrāmyati nityameva gagane taramai namaḥ karṇaṇe // / / //
analyzed: rudroyena kapāla pāṇi puṭake bhikṣāṭanam kāritaḥ sūryaḥ bhrāmyati nityam eva gagane taramai namaḥ karṇaṇe
translated: by whom Shiva, with a skull in his hand, is made to wander for alms; by whom the sun always wanders in the sky - salutations to that Karna.

original: dātā baliryācakako murārirdānaṃ mahī vipramukhasya madhye /
analyzed: dātā baliḥ yācakakaḥ murāriḥ dānam mahī vipra mukhasya madhye
translated: Bali was the giver, Murari the beggar, the earth the gift, in the midst of the Brahmins' faces.

original: dattvā phalaṃ bandhanameva labdhaṃ namo 'stu te daiva yatheṣṭakāriṇe // / / //
analyzed: dattvā phalam bandhanam eva labdham namaḥ stu te daiva yatheṣṭa kāriṇe
translated: Having given the fruit, he obtained only bondage. Salutations to you, O fate, who acts as you please.

original: mātā yadi bhavellakṣmīḥ pitā sākṣājjanārdanaḥ /🔽kubuddhau pratipattiścaittasmindaṇḍaḥ patetsadā // / / //
analyzed: mātā yadi bhavet lakṣmīḥ pitā sākṣāt janārdanaḥ 🔽ku buddhau pratipattiḥ ca ettasmin daṇḍaḥ patet sadā
translated: If Lakshmi were the mother and Janardana himself were the father,🔽and if this (son) had a bad mind and a bad application, then punishment should always fall on him.

analyzed: yena yena yathā yadvat purā karma su niścitam
translated: Whatever acts one has performed in the past, in whatever manner and to whatever extent,

analyzed: tat tat eva antarā bhuṅkte svayam āhitam ātmanā
translated: One experiences the same in the present life, having invited it upon oneself.

original: ātmanā vihitaṃ duḥ khamātmanā vihitaṃ sakham /
analyzed: ātmanā vihitam duḥ kham ātmanā vihitam sakham
translated: One experiences the happiness and sorrow one has created for oneself.

analyzed: garbhaśayyām upādāya bhuṅkte vai paurvadaihikam
translated: From the moment one enters the womb, one experiences the fruits of one's past actions.

original: na cāntarikṣe na samudramadhye na parvatānāṃ vivarapraveśe /
analyzed: na ca antarikṣe na samudra madhye na parvatānām vivara praveśe
translated: Neither in the sky, nor in the ocean, nor by entering the mountains,

original: na mātṛmūrdhni pradhṛtastathāṅke tyaktuṃ kṣamaḥ karma kṛtaṃ naro hi // / / //
analyzed: na mātṛ mūrdhni pradhṛtaḥ tathā aṅke tyaktum kṣamaḥ karma kṛtam naraḥ hi
translated: Nor by holding on to the head or lap of one's mother, can a man escape the consequences of his actions.

original: dugastrikūṭaḥ parikhā samudro rakṣāṃsi yodhāḥ paramā ca vṛttiḥ /
analyzed: dugaḥ tri kūṭaḥ parikhā samudraḥ rakṣāṃsi yodhāḥ paramā ca vṛttiḥ
translated: The three peaks were the difficult path, the ocean was the moat, the demons were the soldiers, and the supreme means of livelihood,

original: śāstrañca vai tūśanasā pradiṣṭaṃ sa rāvaṇaḥ kālavaśādvinaṣṭaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śāstram ca vai tu uśanasā pradiṣṭam sa rāvaṇaḥ kāla vaśāt vinaṣṭaḥ
translated: The scriptures prescribed by Tvashtri, that Ravana was destroyed by the power of time.

original: yasminvayasi yatkāle yaddivā yacca vā niśi /
analyzed: yasmin vayasi yat kāle yat divā yat ca vā niśi
translated: In whatever age, at whatever time, during the day or night,

original: yanmuhūrte kṣaṇe vāpi tattathā na tadanyathā // / / //
analyzed: yat muhūrte kṣaṇe vā api tat tathā na tat anyathā
translated: In whatever muhurta or moment, it is so, not otherwise.

analyzed: gacchanti ca antarikṣe vā praviśanti mahī tale
translated: They go in the sky or enter the earth,

analyzed: dhārayanti diśaḥ sarvāḥ na a dattam upalabhyate
translated: They support all the directions, what is not given is not obtained.

original: purādhītā ca yā vidyā purā dattañca yaddhanam /
analyzed: purā adhītā ca yā vidyā purā dattañca yat dhanam
translated: The knowledge that was studied in the past, and the wealth that was given in the past,

original: purā kṛtāni karmāṇi hyagre dhāvanti dhāvataḥ // / / //
analyzed: purā kṛtāni karmāṇi hi agre dhāvanti dhāvataḥ
translated: The deeds done in the past run ahead of the running ones.

analyzed: karmāṇi atra pradhānāni samyak ṛkṣe śubha grahe
translated: Here, deeds are primary, in a good horoscope with auspicious planets.

analyzed: vasiṣṭha kṛta lagnā api jānakī duḥ kha bhājanam
translated: Even though Janaki's horoscope was made by Vashishtha, she became a receptacle of sorrow.

original: sthūlajaṅgho yadā rāmaḥ śabdagāmī ca lakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: sthūlajaṅghaḥ yadā rāmaḥ śabda gāmī ca lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: When Rama had thick thighs, Lakshmana moved by sound,

original: ghanakeśī yadā sītā trayaste duḥ khabhājanam // / / //
analyzed: ghanakeśī yadā sītā trayaḥ te duḥ kha bhājanam
translated: and Sita had thick hair, the three of them became receptacles of sorrow.

original: na pituḥ karmaṇā putraḥ pitā vā putrakarmaṇā /
analyzed: na pituḥ karmaṇā putraḥ pitā vā putra karmaṇā
translated: A son is not affected by the deeds of his father, nor a father by those of his son.

original: svayaṃ kṛtena gacchanti svayaṃ baddhāḥ svakarmaṇā // / / //
analyzed: svayam kṛtena gacchanti svayam baddhāḥ sva karmaṇā
translated: They go by their own deeds, bound by their own actions.

analyzed: karma janya śarīreṣu rogāḥ śarīra mānasāḥ
translated: Diseases of the body and mind in bodies born of karma

analyzed: śarāḥ iva patanti iha vimuktāḥ dṛḍha dhanvibhiḥ
translated: fall here like arrows shot by strong archers.

analyzed: anyathā śāstra gārbhiṇyā dhiyā dhīraḥ artham īhate
translated: Otherwise, a wise man seeks wealth with a mind pregnant with scriptures.

analyzed: svāmi vat prāk kṛtam karma vidadhāti tat anyathā
translated: Karma done earlier arranges it otherwise, like a master.

original: bālo yuvā ca vṛddhaśca yaḥ karoti śubhāśubham /
analyzed: bālaḥ yuvā ca vṛddhaḥ ca yaḥ karoti śubha aśubham
translated: Whether a child, a youth, or an old man, whoever does good or bad

analyzed: tasya antasyām avasthāyām bhuṅkte janmani janmani
translated: enjoys or suffers in every birth, in the end.

analyzed: an īkṣamāṇaḥ pi naraḥ videśa sthaḥ pi mānavaḥ
translated: A man, even if he does not look, even if he is in a foreign land,

analyzed: sva karma pāta vātena nīyate yatra tat phalam
translated: One is carried away by the wind of one's own karma to where the fruits are.

original: prāptavyamarthaṃ labhate manuṣyo devo 'pi taṃ vārayituṃ na śaktaḥ /
analyzed: prāptavyam artham labhate manuṣyaḥ devaḥ pi tam vārayitum na śaktaḥ
translated: A man obtains what is to be obtained, even the gods cannot prevent it.

original: ato na śocāmi na vismayo me lalāṭalekhā na punaḥ prayāti yadasmadīyaṃ na tu tat pareṣām // / / //
analyzed: atas na śocāmi na vismayaḥ me lalāṭa lekhā na punar prayāti yat asmadīyam na tu tat pareṣām
translated: Therefore, I do not grieve nor am I amazed. The line on the forehead does not go back again. What is ours does not belong to others.

original: sarpaḥ kūpe gajaḥ skandhe bila ākhuśca dhāvati /
analyzed: sarpaḥ kūpe gajaḥ skandhe bile ākhuḥ ca dhāvati
translated: A snake in a well, an elephant on the shoulder, and a rat running in a hole.

analyzed: naraḥ śīghratarāt eva karmaṇaḥ kaḥ palāyate
translated: From which karma does a man quickly flee?

analyzed: na alpā bhavati sat vidyā dīyamānā api vardhate
translated: True knowledge does not become small even when given, it increases.

analyzed: kūpa stham iva pānīyam bhavati eva bahu udakam
translated: Like water in a well, it becomes very much water.

original: yer'thā dharmeṇa te satyā ye 'dharmeṇa gatāḥ śriyaḥ /
analyzed: yerthāḥ dharmeṇa te satyāḥ ye dharmeṇa gatāḥ śriyaḥ
translated: Those things that are with dharma are true, those that go with adharma are glories.

analyzed: ca mahān loke tat smṛtvā hi artha kāraṇāt
translated: And dharma and wealth are great in the world. Remembering that, one should act for the sake of wealth.

original: annārtho yāni duḥ khāni karoti kṛpaṇo janaḥ /
analyzed: anna arthaḥ yāni duḥ khāni karoti kṛpaṇaḥ janaḥ
translated: The miserable person undergoes hardships for the sake of food.

original: tānyeva yadi dharmārtho na bhūyaḥ kleśabhājanam // / / //
analyzed: tāni eva yadi dharma arthaḥ na bhūyas kleśa bhājanam
translated: If those very things are for the sake of dharma, he does not become a vessel of affliction again.

analyzed: sarveṣām eva śaucānām anna śaucam viśiṣyate
translated: Among all kinds of purity, the purity of food is supreme.

original: yo 'nnārthaiḥ śuciḥ śaucānna mṛdā vāriṇā śuciḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ nna arthaiḥ śuciḥ śaucāt na mṛdā vāriṇā śuciḥ
translated: One who is pure in food, not pure with earth or water.

analyzed: satyam śaucam manaḥ śaucam śaucam indriya nigrahaḥ
translated: Truth is purity, purity of mind, restraint of the senses is purity.

analyzed: sarva bhūte dayā śaucam jala śaucam ca pañcamam
translated: Compassion towards all beings is purity, water purity is the fifth.

original: yasya satyañca śaucañca tasya svargo na durlabhaḥ /
analyzed: yasya satyam ca śaucam ca tasya svargaḥ na durlabhaḥ
translated: For one who has truth and purity, heaven is not difficult to attain.

analyzed: satyam hi vacanam yasya saḥ u śvamedhāt viśiṣyate
translated: One whose speech is truthful excels one who performs a horse sacrifice.

analyzed: mṛttikānām sahasreṇa ca udakānām śatena hi
translated: Not with a thousand measures of earth, nor with a hundred sprinklings of water,

analyzed: na śudhyati durācāraḥ bhāva upahata cetanaḥ
translated: Is the ill-behaved one purified, whose mind is affected by emotions.

original: yasya hastau ca pādau ca manaścaiva susaṃyatam /
analyzed: yasya hastau ca pādau ca manaḥ ca eva su saṃyatam
translated: One whose hands, feet, and mind are well-controlled,

analyzed: vidyā tapaḥ ca kīrtiḥ ca sa tīrtha phalam aśnute
translated: Knowledge, austerity, and fame - he enjoys the fruit of the pilgrimage.

analyzed: na prahṛṣyati saṃmānaiḥ na avamānaiḥ prakupyati
translated: One is not delighted by honors, nor angered by insults,

original: na kruddhaḥ paruṣaṃ brūyādetatsādhostu lakṣaṇam // / / //🔽daridrasya manuṣyasya prājñasya madhurasya ca /
analyzed: na kruddhaḥ paruṣam brūyāt etat sādhoḥ tu lakṣaṇam  daridrasya manuṣyasya prājñasya madhurasya ca
translated: When angry, one should not speak harshly - this is the mark of the virtuous.

original: kāle śrutvā hitaṃ vākyaṃ na kaścitparituṣyati // / / //
analyzed: kāle śrutvā hitam vākyam na kaścid parituṣyati
translated: No one is satisfied on hearing timely beneficial words,🔽Of a poor, wise, and sweet-spoken man.

analyzed: na mantra bala vīryeṇa prajñayā pauruṣeṇa ca
translated: Not by the power of mantras, not by wisdom, not by manliness,

analyzed: alabhyam labhyate martyaiḥ tatra kā parivedanā
translated: What is unattainable is obtained by mortals there, what is the use of lamenting?

analyzed: a yācitaḥ mayā labdho punar mad preṣaṇāt gataḥ
translated: Unasked, I obtained him, and again he has gone by my sending.

analyzed: yatra āgataḥ tatra gataḥ tatra kā parivedanā
translated: Where he has come, he has gone there, what is the use of lamenting there?

analyzed: eka vṛkṣe sadā rātrau nānā pakṣi samāgamaḥ
translated: On one tree, at night, there is a gathering of many birds.

analyzed: prabhāte yānti kā tatra parivedanā
translated: In the morning, they go in different directions, what is the use of lamenting there?

analyzed: eka sārtha prayātānā sarveṣām tatra gāminām
translated: For all those who travel together in one caravan, going there,

analyzed: yaḥ tu ekaḥ tvaritaḥ yāti kā tatra parivedanā
translated: if one goes quickly alone, what is the use of lamenting there?

analyzed: avyakta ādīni bhūtāni vyakta madhyāni śaunaka
translated: O Shaunaka, beings have an unmanifest beginning, a manifest middle,

original: avyaktanidhanānyenava kā tatra parivedanā // / / //🔽nāprāptakālo mriyate viddhaḥ śaraśatairapi /
analyzed: kā tatra parivedanā  na aprāpta kālaḥ mriyate viddhaḥ śara śataiḥ api
translated: and an unmanifest end, what is the use of lamenting there?🔽One does not die before one's time, even if pierced by hundreds of arrows.

original: kuśāgreṇa tu saṃspṛṣṭaṃ prāptakālo na jīvati // / / //
analyzed: kuśa agreṇa tu saṃspṛṣṭam prāpta kālaḥ na jīvati
translated: But one who has reached one's time does not live, even if touched by the tip of a kusha grass.

analyzed: labdhavyāni eva labhate gantavyāni eva gacchati
translated: One obtains only what is to be obtained, one goes only where one is to go.

original: prāptavyānyeva prāpnāti duḥ khāni ca sukhāni ca // / / //
analyzed: prāptavyāni eva prāpnāti duḥ khāni ca sukhāni ca
translated: One attains only what is to be attained, both sorrows and joys.

analyzed: tat tat prāpnoti puruṣaḥ ki pralāpaiḥ kariṣyati
translated: A man obtains whatever is to be obtained, what will lamentations do?

original: ācodyamānāni yathā puṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca /
analyzed: ācodyamānāni yathā puṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca
translated: Just as flowers and fruits, when they are ready, do not wait for being plucked,

analyzed: sva kālam na ativartante tathā karma purā kṛtam
translated: but fall down by themselves, so also the acts done in a previous birth.

original: śīlaṃ kulaṃ naiva na caiva vidyā jñānaṃ guṇā naiva na bījaśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: śīlam kulam na eva na ca eva vidyā jñānam guṇāḥ na eva na bīja śuddhiḥ
translated: Character, family, learning, knowledge, virtues, purity of birth,

original: bhāgyāni pūrvaṃ tapasārjitāni kāle phalantyasya yathaiva vṛkṣāḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhāgyāni pūrvam tapasā arjitāni kāle phalanti asya yathā eva vṛkṣāḥ
translated: all these are not the cause of one's prosperity; it is the good deeds performed in previous births that bear fruit in due course, like trees.

original: tatra mṛtyuryatra hantā tatra śrīryatra sampadaḥ /
analyzed: tatra mṛtyuḥ yatra hantā tatra śrīḥ yatra sampadaḥ
translated: Where there is death, there is the destroyer; where there is prosperity, there are riches.

original: tatra tatra svayaṃ yāti preryamāṇaḥ svakarmabhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatra tatra svayam yāti preryamāṇaḥ sva karmabhiḥ
translated: Everywhere one goes by oneself, impelled by one's own actions.

analyzed: bhūta pūrvam kṛtam karma kartāram anutiṣṭhati
translated: An action done in the past follows the doer.

analyzed: yathā dhenu sahasreṣu vatsaḥ vindanti mātaram
translated: Just as a calf finds its mother among a thousand cows,

analyzed: evam pūrva kṛtam karma kartāram anutiṣṭhāti
translated: so does the action done in the past follow the doer.

original: sukṛtaṃ bhuṅkṣva cātmīyaṃ mūḍha kiṃ paritapyase // / / //
analyzed: sukṛtam bhuṅkṣva ca ātmīyam mūḍha kim paritapyase
translated: Enjoy your own good deeds, O fool, why do you grieve over others?

original: yathā pūrvakṛtaṃ karma śubhaṃ vā yadi vāśubham /
analyzed: yathā pūrva kṛtam karma śubham vā yadi vā aśubham
translated: As one's own good or bad deeds done in the past,

analyzed: tathā janmāntare tat vai kartāram anugacchati
translated: so does one experience in the next birth, the doer follows them.

analyzed: nīcaḥ sarṣapa mātrāṇi para chidrāṇi paśyati
translated: A low person sees the faults of others, as small as mustard seeds,

analyzed: ātmanaḥ paśyan api na paśyati
translated: Even seeing the offerings made to himself, he does not see.

analyzed: rāga dveṣa ādi yuktānām na sukham kutracid dvija
translated: For those who are full of passion, hatred, and so on, there is no happiness anywhere, O Brahmin.

original: vicārya khalu paśyāmi tatsukhaṃ yatra nirvṛtiḥ // / / //
analyzed: vicārya khalu paśyāmi tat sukham yatra nirvṛtiḥ
translated: Having considered, I see that happiness where there is peace.

original: yatra sneho bhayaṃ tatra sneho duḥ khasya bhājanam /
analyzed: yatra snehaḥ bhayam tatra snehaḥ duḥkhasya bhājanam
translated: Where there is affection, there is fear. Affection is a vessel of suffering.

analyzed: sneha mūlāni duḥ khāni tasmin tyakte mahat sukham
translated: Sufferings have affection as their root. When that is abandoned, there is great happiness.

original: śarīramevāyatanaṃ duḥ khasya ca sukhasya ca /
analyzed: śarīram eva āyatanam duḥ khasya ca sukhasya ca
translated: The body itself is the abode of both suffering and happiness.

analyzed: jīvitañca śarīrañca jātyā eva saha jāyate
translated: And life and body are born together with birth.

original: sarvaṃ paravaśaṃ duḥ khaṃ sarva mātmavaśaṃ sukham /
analyzed: sarvam para vaśam duḥ kham
translated: Everything that is dependent on others is suffering, everything that is dependent on oneself is happiness.

analyzed: etat vidyāt samāsena lakṣaṇam sukha duḥ khayoḥ
translated: One should know this in brief as the characteristic of happiness and suffering.

original: sukhasyānantaraṃ duḥ khaṃ duḥ khasyānantaraṃ sukham /
analyzed: sukhasya anantaram duḥkham duḥkhasya anantaram sukham
translated: Immediately after happiness comes suffering, immediately after suffering comes happiness.

analyzed: śukham duḥ kham manuṣyāṇām cakra vat parivartate
translated: Happiness and suffering of humans revolve like a wheel.

analyzed: yat gatam tat atikrāntam yadi syāt tat ca dūratas
translated: What has passed is already gone, and if it were to come again, it is far away.

original: vartamānena varteta na sa śokena bādhyate // / / //
analyzed: vartamānena varteta na sa śokena bādhyate
translated: One should live in the present, and is not afflicted by sorrow.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe pūrvakhaṇḍe prathamāṃśākhye ācārakāṇḍe bṛhadṛ nītisāre trayośottaraśatatamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe pūrva khaṇḍe prathama aṃśa ākhye ācāra kāṇḍe nīti sāre trayośottaraśatatamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the One Hundred and Thirteen Chapter, in the First Part, of the Srimad-Bhagavatam, dealing with the Narration of the Birth of Prahlada and the Destruction of the Asuras.

analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: The Glorious Garuda Mahapurana

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

analyzed: na kaścid kasyacid mitram na kaścid kasyacid ripuḥ
translated: No one is a friend of anyone, no one is an enemy of anyone.

analyzed: kāraṇāt eva jāyante mitrāṇi ripavaḥ tathā
translated: Friends and enemies arise only due to causes.

analyzed: śoka trāṇam bhaya trāṇam prīti viśvāsa bhājanam
translated: The refuge from sorrow, the refuge from fear, the vessel of affection and trust,

analyzed: kena sṛṣṭam mitram iti akṣara dvayam
translated: By whom was this jewel, the two syllables friend, created?

analyzed: sakṛt uccaritam yena hariḥ iti akṣara dvayam
translated: By whom the two syllables Hari are uttered once,

analyzed: baddhaḥ parikaraḥ tena mokṣāya gamanam prati
translated: By him the bond is made for the journey to liberation.

original: na mātari na dāreṣu na sodarye na cātmaje /
analyzed: na mātari na dāreṣu na sodarye na ca ātmaje
translated: Not in a mother, not in a wife, not in a brother, not in a son,

analyzed: viśvāsaḥ tādṛśaḥ puṃsām yādṛś mitre svabhāva je
translated: Such trust do men have in friends born of their own nature.

analyzed: yat icchet śāśvatīm prītim trīn doṣān parivarjayet
translated: If one desires eternal friendship, one should avoid three faults:

analyzed: dyutam artha prayogam ca parokṣe dāra darśanam
translated: Gambling, misuse of wealth, and seeing one's wife in private.

original: mātrā svastrā duhitrā vā na viviktāsano vaset /
analyzed: mātrā svastrā duhitrā vā na vivikta āsanaḥ vaset
translated: One should not sit alone with one's mother, sister, or daughter,

analyzed: balavān indriya grāmaḥ vidvāṃsam api karṣati
translated: The powerful group of senses drags even the learned.

analyzed: viparīta ratiḥ kāmaḥ su āyateṣu na vidyate
translated: Desire for the opposite sex is not found in those who are self-controlled.

original: yathopāyo vadho daṇḍastathaiva hyanu vartate // / / //🔽api kalpānilasyaiva turagasya mahodadheḥ /
analyzed: yathā upāyaḥ vadhaḥ daṇḍaḥ tathā eva hi anu vartate  api kalpa anilasya eva turagasya mahā udadheḥ
translated: Punishment, which is like a means of killing, follows accordingly.🔽Even the speed of the wind, the horse, and the great ocean can be measured,

original: śakyate prasaro boddhuṃ na hyaraktasye catasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śakyate prasaraḥ boddhum na hi a raktasye catasaḥ
translated: but not the speed of the mind of one who is not detached.

original: kṣaṇo nāsti raho nāsti na sti prārthayitā janaḥ /
analyzed: kṣaṇaḥ na asti rahaḥ na asti na sti prārthayitā janaḥ
translated: There is no moment, no privacy, no one to request,

analyzed: tena śaunaka nārīṇām satī tvam upajāyate
translated: therefore, Shaunaka, chastity arises in women.

analyzed: vai sevate nityam anyaḥ ceta api rocate
translated: One always serves one man, and another is also liked,

analyzed: puruṣāṇām alābhena nārī ca eva pativratā
translated: and the woman is faithful to her husband due to the unavailability of men.

analyzed: jananī yāni kurute rahasyam madana āturā
translated: The secret things that a mother does out of passion,

original: sutaistāni na cintyāni śīlavipratipattibhiḥ // / / //🔽parādhīnā nidrā paradṛdayakṛtyānusaraṇaṃ sadā helā hāsyaṃ niyatamapi śokena rahitam /
analyzed: sutaiḥ tāni na cintyāni śīla vipratipattibhiḥ  para adhīnā nidrā para dṛdaya kṛtyā anusaraṇam sadā helā hāsyam niyatam api śokena rahitam
translated: those should not be thought of by her sons, due to the violation of morality.🔽Sleep is under the control of others, always following the activities of others' hearts, and there is always a playful smile, even in the absence of sorrow.

original: paṇe nyastaḥ kāyo viṭajanakhurairdāritagalo bahūtkaṇṭhavṛtirjagati gaṇikrāyā bahumataḥ // / / //
analyzed: paṇe nyastaḥ kāyaḥ viṭa jana khuraiḥ dārita galaḥ bahu utkaṇṭha vṛtiḥ jagati bahu mataḥ
translated: The body is staked in gambling, the throat is torn by the claws of the libertines, and there is much longing and anxiety in the world, the courtesan is highly regarded.

original: agnirāpaḥ striyo mūrkhāḥ sarpā rājakulāni ca /
analyzed: agniḥ āpaḥ striyaḥ mūrkhāḥ sarpāḥ rāja kulāni ca
translated: Fire, water, women, fools, snakes, and royal courts -

original: nityaṃ paropasevyāni sadyaḥ prāṇaharāṇi ṣaṭ // / / //🔽kiṃ citraṃ yadi veda śabda
analyzed: nityam para upasevyāni sadyas prāṇa harāṇi ṣaḍ  kim citram yadi veda śabda
translated: these six are always to be served by others, but they can instantly kill.

original: śāstrakuśalo vipro bhavetpaṇḍitaḥ kiṃ citraṃ yadi daṇḍanītikuśalo rājā bhaveddhārmikaḥ /
analyzed: śāstra kuśalaḥ vipraḥ bhavet paṇḍitaḥ kim citram yadi daṇḍa nīti kuśalaḥ rājā bhavet dhārmikaḥ
translated: What is surprising if a Brahmin well-versed in the Vedas becomes learned? What is surprising if a king, skilled in governance, becomes righteous?

original: kiṃ citraṃ yadi rūpayauvanavatī sādhvī bhavetkāminī taccitraṃ yadi nirdhano 'pi puruṣaḥ pāpaṃ na kuryātkracit // / / //
analyzed: kim citram yadi rūpa yauvanavatī sādhvī bhavet kāminī tat citram yadi nirdhanaḥ pi puruṣaḥ pāpam na kuryāt kracid
translated: What is surprising if a virtuous young woman endowed with beauty and youth becomes a good lover? It is surprising if a poor man never commits sin at any time.

analyzed: na ātma chidram pare dadyāt vidyāt chidram parasya ca
translated: One should not reveal one's own faults to others, but should know the faults of others.

analyzed: gūhet kūrmaḥ iva aṅgāni para bhāvañca lakṣayet
translated: One should conceal one's own faults like a tortoise its limbs, and should discern the feelings of others.

analyzed: pātāla tala vā sinyaḥ ucca prākāra saṃsthitāḥ
translated: Even if women are living in the nether regions, or on high walls,

original: yadi no cikurodbhedāllabhyante kaiḥ striyo na hi // / / //
analyzed: yadi no cikura udbhedāt labhyante kaiḥ striyaḥ na hi
translated: if they are not obtained through the parting of hair, by whom are they not obtained?

analyzed: sama dharmā hi marma jñaḥ tīkṣṇaḥ sva jana kaṇṭakaḥ
translated: An enemy who is of equal dharma, who knows the vulnerable points, who is sharp, and who is a thorn to one's own people,

original: na tathā bādhate śatruḥ kṛtavairo bahiḥ sthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na tathā bādhate śatruḥ kṛta vairaḥ bahis sthitaḥ
translated: does not cause as much harm as an external enemy who has formed enmity.

original: sa paṇḍito yo hyanuñjayedvai miṣṭena bālaṃ viniyena śiṣṭam /
analyzed: sa paṇḍitaḥ yaḥ miṣṭena bālam śiṣṭam
translated: He is wise who would conciliate a child with sweets and instruct a learned person with reason.

original: arthena nārīṃ tapasā hi devānsarvāṃśca lokāṃśca susaṃgraheṇa // / / //
analyzed: arthena nārīm tapasā hi devān sarvān ca lokān ca su saṃgraheṇa
translated: A woman by wealth, the gods by penance, and all the worlds by good conduct.

original: chalena mitraṃ kaluṣeṇa dharmaṃ paropatāpena samṛddhibhāvanam /
analyzed: chalena mitram kaluṣeṇa dharmam para upatāpena samṛddhi bhāvanam
translated: By deceit a friend, by impurity dharma, and by afflicting others, prosperity.

original: sukhena vidyāṃ puruṣeṇa nārīṃ vāñchanti vai ye na ca paṇḍitāste // / / //🔽phalārtho phalinaṃ vṛkṣaṃ yaśchindyāddurmatirnaraḥ /
analyzed: sukhena vidyām puruṣeṇa nārīm vāñchanti vai ye na ca paṇḍitāḥ te  phalinam vṛkṣam yaḥ chindyāt durmatiḥ naraḥ
translated: Those who desire knowledge by happiness, a woman by a man, they are not wise.🔽A man of evil mind who cuts down a fruit-bearing tree for the sake of fruit,

analyzed: niṣphalam tasya vai kāryām mahā doṣam avāpnuyāt
translated: He will reap great harm from that fruitless deed.

original: sadhano hi tapasvī ca dūrato vai kṛtaśramaḥ /
analyzed: sa dhanaḥ hi tapasvī ca dūratas vai kṛta śramaḥ
translated: The ascetic with wealth, having made effort from afar,

original: madyapa strī satītyevaṃ vipra na śraddadhāmyaham // / / //
analyzed: madyapa strī satī iti evam vipra na śraddadhāmi aham
translated: I do not believe in a drunkard, a woman, or a chaste brahmin.

analyzed: na viśvaset aviśvaste mitrasya api na viśvaset
translated: One should not trust the untrustworthy, one should not trust even a friend.

analyzed: kadācid kupitam mitram sarvam guhyam prakāśayet
translated: Sometimes an angry friend may reveal all the secrets.

analyzed: sarva bhūteṣu viśvāsaḥ sarva bhūteṣu sāttvikaḥ
translated: Trust in all beings, in all beings is sattva.

analyzed: svabāvam ātmanā gūhet etat sādhoḥ hi lakṣaṇam
translated: One should conceal one's nature by oneself, this is the characteristic of a good person.

analyzed: yasmin kasmin kṛte kārye kartāram anuvartate
translated: In whatever task is done, one should follow the doer.

analyzed: sarvathā vartamānaḥ kārayet
translated: One should always maintain a steadfast mind, no matter what the situation may be.

original: vṛddhāḥ striyo navaṃ madyaṃ śuṣkaṃ māṃsaṃ trimūlakam /
analyzed: vṛddhāḥ striyaḥ navam madyam śuṣkam māṃsam tri mūlakam
translated: An old woman, new liquor, dry meat, the three roots (ginger, turmeric, and black pepper),

original: rātrau dadhi divā svapnaṃ vidvānṣaṭ parivarjayet // / / //
analyzed: rātrau dadhi divā svapnam vidvān ṣaḍ parivarjayet
translated: curds at night, and sleeping during the day - a wise person should avoid these six.

original: viṣaṃ goṣṭhī daridrasya vṛddhasya taruṇī viṣam /
analyzed: viṣam goṣṭhī daridrasya vṛddhasya taruṇī viṣam
translated: A gathering is poison for the poor, a young woman is poison for the old,

original: viṣaṃ kuśikṣitā vidyā ajīrṇe bhojanaṃ viṣam // / / //
analyzed: viṣam kuśikṣitā vidyā ajīrṇe bhojanam viṣam
translated: poison is for one who is not well-versed in learning, and food is poison when one has indigestion.

analyzed: priyam gānam akuṇṭhasya nīcasya ucca āsanam priyam
translated: Singing is dear to one who is not crippled, a high seat is dear to one who is low,

analyzed: priyam dānam daridrasya bhūnaśca taruṇī priyā
translated: giving is dear to the poor, and a young woman is dear to one who is old.

analyzed: ati ambu pānam kaṭhina aśanam ca dhātu kṣayaḥ vega vidhāraṇam ca
translated: Drinking too much water, eating hard food, wasting of body elements, suppressing natural urges,

original: divāśayo jāgaraṇañca rātrau ṣaḍbhirnarāṇāṃ nivasanti rogāḥ // / / //🔽bālātapaścāpyatimaithunañca śmaśānadhūmaḥ karatāpanañca /🔽rajasvalāvatkranirīkṣaṇañca sudīrghamāyurnanu karṣayecca // / / //
analyzed: divā āśayaḥ jāgaraṇam ca rātrau ṣaḍbhiḥ narāṇām nivasanti rogāḥ  bāla ātapaḥ ca api ati maithunam ca śmaśāna dhūmaḥ kara tāpanam ca  rajasvalā vatkra nirīkṣaṇam ca su dīrgham āyuḥ nanu karṣayet ca
translated: sleeping during the day and staying awake at night - these six are the causes of diseases in humans.🔽The early morning sun, excessive sexual intercourse, smoke from a cremation ground, fanning oneself,🔽and looking at a menstruating woman - these certainly shorten one's life.

original: śuṣkaṃ māṃsaṃ striyo vṛddhā bālārkastaruṇaṃ dadhi /
analyzed: śuṣkam māṃsam striyaḥ vṛddhāḥ bāla arkaḥ taruṇam dadhi
translated: Dry meat, old women, the rising sun, fresh curd,

original: prabhāte maithunaṃ nidrā sadyaḥ prāṇaharāṇi ṣaṭ // / / //
analyzed: prabhāte maithunam nidrā sadyas prāṇa harāṇi ṣaḍ
translated: Sexual intercourse, sleep, and the six things that instantly kill life force.

original: sadyaḥ pakraghṛtaṃ drākṣā bālā strī kṣīrabhojanam /
analyzed: sadyas pakra ghṛtam drākṣā bālā strī kṣīra bhojanam
translated: Fresh ghee, grapes, a young woman, milk, food,

analyzed: uṣṇa udakam taru chāyā sadyas prāṇa harāṇi ṣaḍ
translated: Hot water, and the shade of a tree - these six things instantly kill life force.

analyzed: kūpādakam vaṭa chāyā nārīṇām ca payodharaḥ
translated: Water from a well, the shade of a banyan tree, and the breasts of women,

original: śītakāle bhaveduṣṇamuṣṇakāle ca śītalam // / / //🔽trayo balakarāḥ sadyo bālābhyaṅgasubhojanam /
analyzed: śīta kāle bhavet uṣṇam uṣṇa kāle ca śītalam  trayaḥ bala karāḥ sadyas bāla abhyaṅga su bhojanam
translated: Are hot in cold weather and cool in hot weather.🔽Three things instantly give strength - oil massage, good food, and youth.

original: trayo balaharāḥ sadyo hyadhvā ve maithunaṃ jvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: trayaḥ bala harāḥ sadyas hi adhvā maithunam jvaraḥ
translated: Three things instantly take away strength - travel, sexual intercourse, and fever.

original: śuṣkaṃ māṃsaṃ payo nityaṃ bhāryāmitraiḥ sahaiva tu /
analyzed: śuṣkam māṃsam payaḥ nityam bhāryā mitraiḥ saha eva tu
translated: Dry meat, milk, and always with enemies and wife,

original: na bhāktavyaṃ nṛpaiḥ sārdhaṃ viyogaṃ kurute kṣaṇāt // / / //
analyzed: na bhāktavyam nṛpaiḥ sārdham viyogam kurute kṣaṇāt
translated: One should not associate with kings, as they cause separation in an instant.

analyzed: danta mala upadhāriṇam bahu āśinam niṣṭhura vākya bhāṣiṇam
translated: One who wears dirty clothes, has tartar on the teeth, eats a lot, speaks harsh words,

original: sūryodaye hyastamaye 'pi śāyinaṃ vimuñcati śrīrapi cakrapāṇinam // / / //
analyzed: sūrya udaye hi astamaye śāyinam vimuñcati śrīḥ api cakrapāṇinam
translated: And sleeps at sunrise and sunset, even Shri abandons such a person, even if he is the wielder of the discus.

original: nityaṃ chedastṛṇānaṃ dharaṇivilakhanaṃ pādayoścāpamārṣṭiḥ dantānāmapyaśaucaṃ malinavasanatā rūkṣatā mūrdhajānām /
analyzed: nityam chedaḥ tṛṇānam dharaṇi vilakhanam pādayoḥ ca apamārṣṭiḥ dantānām api aśaucam malina vasana tā rūkṣa tā mūrdhajānām
translated: Constant cutting of grass, digging the ground, rubbing the feet, unclean teeth, dirty clothes, and roughness of the hair,

original: dve sadhye cāpi nidrā vivasanaśayanaṃ grāsahāsātirekaḥ svāṅge pīṭhe ca vādyaṃ nidhanamupanayetkeśavasyāpi lakṣmīm // / / //
analyzed: dve sadhye ca api nidrā vivasana śayanam grāsa hāsa atirekaḥ sva aṅge pīṭhe ca vādyam nidhanam upanayet keśavasya api lakṣmīm
translated: Two middays, sleep, sleeping without clothes, excessive eating, laughing, playing on one's own body and seat, would lead to death, even of Vishnu's Lakshmi.

analyzed: śiraḥ su dhautam caraṇau su mārjitau vara aṅganā sevanam alpa bhojanam
translated: A well-washed head, well-cleaned feet, serving a beautiful woman, eating little,

analyzed: anagna śāyi tvam aparva maithunam cira pranaṣṭām śriyam ānayanti ṣaḍ
translated: Sleeping without fire, having intercourse without festivals - these six bring back lost prosperity.

original: yasya kasya tu puṣpasya pāṇāḍarasya viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: yasya kasya tu puṣpasya pāṇāḍarasya viśeṣataḥ
translated: Of any flower, especially of the pāṇḍara flower,

analyzed: śirasā dhāryamāṇasya hi alakṣmīḥ pratihanyate
translated: When worn on the head, it wards off misfortune.

original: dīpasya paścimā chāyā chāyā śayyāsanasya ca /
analyzed: dīpasya paścimā chāyā chāyā śayyā āsanasya ca
translated: The western shadow of a lamp, the shadow of a bed or seat,

analyzed: rajakasya tu yat tīrtha lakṣmīḥ tatra tiṣṭhati
translated: The prosperity of a washerman's sacred place remains there.

original: bālātapaḥ pretadhūmaḥ strī vṛddhā taruṇaṃ dadhi /
analyzed: bāla ātapaḥ pretadhūmaḥ strī vṛddhā taruṇam dadhi
translated: The morning sun, funeral smoke, an old woman, curd for a young man,

analyzed: āyuṣkāmaḥ na seveta tathā saṃmārjanī rajaḥ
translated: One seeking longevity should not serve, as well as the dust of a broom.

analyzed: gaja aśva ratha dhānyānām gavām ca eva rajaḥ śubham
translated: The dust raised by elephants, horses, chariots, grains, and cows is auspicious.

analyzed: aśubham ca vijānīyāt khara uṣṭra ja āvikeṣu ca
translated: One should know that the dust raised by donkeys, camels, and goats is inauspicious.

analyzed: gavām rajaḥ dhānya rajaḥ putrasya aṅga bhavam rajaḥ
translated: The dust of cows, the dust of grains, and the dust on the body of a son,

analyzed: etat rajaḥ mahā śastam mahāpātaka nāśanam
translated: This dust is highly praiseworthy and destroys even the gravest sins.

analyzed: ajā rajaḥ khara rajaḥ yat tu saṃmārjanī rajaḥ
translated: The dust of goats, the dust of donkeys, and the dust of the broom,

analyzed: etat rajaḥ mahā pāpam mahā kilbiṣa kārakam
translated: This dust is a great sin and causes great defilement.

analyzed: śūrpa vātaḥ nakha agra ambu snāna vastra mṛjā udakam
translated: The wind from the winnowing basket, the water from the tips of nails, the water used for bathing and cleaning clothes,

original: keśāmbu mārjanīreṇurhanti puṇyaṃ purā kṛtam // / / //🔽viprayorvipravahnyośca dampatyoḥ svāminostathā /
analyzed: keśa ambu mārjanī reṇuḥ hanti puṇyam purā kṛtam  viprayoḥ vipra vahnyoḥ ca dampatyoḥ svāminoḥ tathā
translated: The water from hair, the dust from the broom, destroy the merit earned earlier.🔽One should not pass between a couple of Brahmins, a couple of fires, a married couple, or a master and his servant,

original: antareṇa na gantavyaṃ hayasya vṛṣabhasya ca // / / //
analyzed: antareṇa na gantavyam hayasya vṛṣabhasya ca
translated: Or between a horse and a bull.

analyzed: strīṣu rāja agni sarpeṣu svādhyāye śatru sevane
translated: In women, kings, fire, snakes, self-study, serving enemies,

analyzed: bhoga āsvādeṣu viśvāsam kaḥ prājñaḥ kartum arhati
translated: and in the pleasures of enjoyment, what wise person deserves to have faith?

analyzed: na viśvaset aviśvastam viśvastam viśvastam na ati viśvaset
translated: One should not trust the untrustworthy, and even the trustworthy one should not be excessively trusted.

analyzed: viśvāsāt bhayam utpannam mūlāt api nikṛntati
translated: Fear arising from trust cuts off even from the very roots.

original: vairiṇā saha sandhāya viśvasto yadi tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: vairiṇā saha sandhāya viśvastaḥ yadi tiṣṭhati
translated: If one remains confident after making peace with an enemy,

original: sa vṛkṣāgre prasupto hi patitaḥ pratibudhyate // / / //
analyzed: sa vṛkṣa agre prasuptaḥ hi patitaḥ pratibudhyate
translated: he is like one who sleeps on the top of a tree and wakes up when he falls down.

analyzed: na atyantam mṛdunā bhāvyam na atyantam kūra karmaṇā
translated: One should not be too soft, nor act too harshly.

analyzed: mṛdunā eva mṛdum hanti dāruṇena eva dāruṇam
translated: One kills the soft with softness, and the hard with harshness.

analyzed: na atyantam saralaiḥ bhāvyam na atyantam mṛdunā tathā
translated: One should not be too straightforward, nor too soft.

analyzed: saralāḥ tatra chidyante kubjāḥ tiṣṭhanti pādapāḥ
translated: Straightforward trees are cut down, while crooked ones remain standing.

original: namanti phalino vṛkṣā namanti guṇino janāḥ /
analyzed: namanti phalinaḥ vṛkṣāḥ namanti guṇinaḥ janāḥ
translated: Fruit-bearing trees bend down, and people with good qualities bow down.

original: śuṣkavṛkṣāśca mūrkhāśca bhidyante na namanti ca // / / //
analyzed: śuṣka vṛkṣāḥ ca mūrkhāḥ ca bhidyante na namanti ca
translated: Dry trees and fools do not bend, but break.

original: aprārthitāni duḥ khāni yathaivāyānti yānti ca /
analyzed: a prārthitāni duḥ khāni yathā eva āyānti yānti ca
translated: Just as sorrows come and go unasked,

original: mārjāra iva lumpeta tathā prārthayitāra naraḥ // / / //
analyzed: mārjāraḥ iva lumpeta tathā naraḥ
translated: so a man who seeks them will be destroyed, like a cat.

analyzed: pūrvam paścāt caranti ārye sadā eva bahu sampadaḥ
translated: Noble people always have abundant wealth, whether in the past or future.

analyzed: viparītam anārye ca yathā icchasi tathā cara
translated: The opposite is true for the ignoble. Do as you wish.

analyzed: ṣaṣ karṇaḥ bhidyate mantraḥ catuḥ karṇaḥ ca dhāryate
translated: A secret discussed by six people is broken, and one discussed by four is remembered.

original: dvikarṇasya tu mantrasya brahmāpyanta na budhyate // / / //
analyzed: dvi karṇasya tu mantrasya na budhyate
translated: Even Brahma cannot understand a secret discussed by two.

original: tayā gavā kiṃ kriyate yā na dogdhrī na garbhiṇī /
analyzed: tayā gavā kim kriyate yā na dogdhrī na garbhiṇī
translated: What is the use of a cow that does not yield milk nor conceive?

original: kor'tha putreṇa jātena yo na vidvānna dhārmikaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kortha putreṇa jātena yaḥ na vidvān na dhārmikaḥ
translated: What is the use of a son born who is neither learned nor virtuous?

analyzed: ekena api su putreṇa vidyā yuktena dhīmatā
translated: Even by a single good son endowed with learning and intelligence,

analyzed: kulam puruṣa siṃhena candreṇa gaganam yathā
translated: a family is made resplendent like the sky by the lion among men, the moon.

analyzed: ekena api su vṛkṣeṇa puṣpitena su gandhinā
translated: Even by a single well-flowered and fragrant tree,

original: vanaṃ suvāsitaṃ sarvaṃ suputreṇa kulaṃ yathā // / / //
analyzed: vanam su vāsitam sarvam su putreṇa kulam yathā
translated: the entire forest is made fragrant, just as a family by a good son.

original: eko hi guṇavānputro nirguṇena śatena kim /
analyzed: ekaḥ hi guṇavān putraḥ nirguṇena śatena kim
translated: One virtuous son is better than a hundred worthless ones.

original: candro hanti tamāṃsyeko na ca jyotiḥ sahasrakam // / / //
analyzed: candraḥ hanti tamāṃsi ekaḥ na ca jyotiḥ sahasrakam
translated: The moon alone destroys darkness, not a thousand stars.

analyzed: lālayet pañca varṣāṇi daśa varṣāṇi tāḍayet
translated: One should fondle a child for five years, beat him for ten years,

original: prāpte tu ṣoḍaśe varṣe putraṃ mitravadācaret // / / //
analyzed: prāpte tu ṣoḍaśe varṣe putram mitra vat ācaret
translated: and treat him as a friend after he reaches sixteen years of age.

analyzed: jāyamānaḥ haret dārān vardhamānaḥ haret dhanam
translated: A son born takes away one's wife, a son growing takes away one's wealth,

analyzed: mriyamāṇaḥ haret prāṇān na asti putra samaḥ ripuḥ
translated: and a dying son takes away one's life. There is no enemy like a son.

analyzed: kecid mṛga mukhāḥ vyāghrāḥ kecid vyāghra mukhāḥ mṛgāḥ
translated: Some have the face of a deer but are tigers, some have the face of a tiger but are deer.

analyzed: hi aviśvāsaḥ pade pade
translated: In the absence of a clear knowledge of their true nature, there is distrust at every step.

analyzed: ekaḥ kṣamāvatām doṣaḥ dvitīyaḥ nā upapadyate
translated: There is only one fault in those who are forgiving, and a second one does not occur.

original: yadenaṃ kṣamayā yuktamaśaktaṃ manyate janaḥ // / / //🔽etadevānumanyeta bhogā hi kṣaṇabhaṅginaḥ /
analyzed: yat enam kṣamayā yuktam aśaktam manyate janaḥ  etat eva anumanyeta bhogāḥ hi kṣaṇa bhaṅginaḥ
translated: That people consider one who is endowed with forgiveness to be weak.🔽One should approve of this alone, for enjoyments are subject to destruction in a moment.

original: snigdheṣu ca vidagdhasya matayo vai hyanākulāḥ // / / //
analyzed: snigdheṣu ca vidagdhasya matayaḥ vai hi an ākulāḥ
translated: The minds of those who are affectionate and skilled are indeed undisturbed.

original: jyeṣṭhaḥ pitṛsamo bhrātā mṛte pitari śaunaka /
analyzed: jyeṣṭhaḥ pitṛ samaḥ bhrātā mṛte pitari śaunaka
translated: O Shaunaka, the eldest brother is like a father when the father is dead.

analyzed: sarveṣām sa pitā hi syāt sarveṣām anupālakaḥ
translated: He should be the father of all and the protector of all.

analyzed: kaniṣṭheṣu ca sarveṣu sama tvena anuvartate
translated: He behaves equally towards all the younger ones.

analyzed: yathā evam tanayeṣu ca
translated: And towards the sons who are equal in enjoyment and livelihood.

analyzed: bahūnām alpa sārāṇām samavāyaḥ hi dāruṇaḥ
translated: A collection of many things of little essence is indeed terrible.

analyzed: tṛṇaiḥ āveṣṭitā rajjuḥ tayā badhyate
translated: A rope is wrapped with grass, and with that even an elephant is bound.

original: apahṛtya parasvaṃ hi yastu dānaṃ prayacchati /
analyzed: apahṛtya para svam hi yaḥ tu dānam prayacchati
translated: One who gives a gift after stealing the property of others,

original: sa dātā narakaṃ yāti yasyārthāstasya tatphalam // / / //
analyzed: sa dātā narakam yāti yasya arthāḥ tasya tat phalam
translated: that giver goes to hell, for the fruit belongs to him whose wealth it is.

analyzed: deva dravya vināśena brahma sva haraṇena ca
translated: By destroying the property of gods, by stealing the property of Brahmins,

analyzed: kulāni akula tām yānti brāhmaṇa atikrameṇa ca
translated: and by transgressing Brahmins, families go to a state of non-family.

original: brahmaghne ca surāpe ca core bhagnavrate tathā /
analyzed: brahma ghne ca surā pe ca core bhagna vrate tathā
translated: In the case of a killer of Brahmins, a drinker of liquor, a thief, and one who has broken a vow,

analyzed: niṣkṛtiḥ vihitā sadbhiḥ kṛtaghne na asti niṣkṛtiḥ
translated: There is no expiation for the ungrateful.

analyzed: pitaraḥ devāḥ kṣudrasya vṛṣalī pateḥ
translated: The manes and gods do not accept the offerings of a mean man who keeps a shudra woman.

analyzed: bhāryā jitasya yasyāḥ ca upapatiḥ gṛhe  dīrdha roṣam anārjavam
translated: Nor do they accept the offerings of one who is dominated by his wife or who has a paramour in his house.

analyzed: caturaḥ viddhi cāṇḍālān jātyā jāyeta pañcamaḥ
translated: Know the four kinds of chandalas: one born of a shudra woman, one born of an unchaste woman, one born of a woman of the lowest caste, and one born of a woman of mixed caste. The fifth is born of one's own womb.

analyzed: na upekṣitavyaḥ śatruḥ alpaḥ pi avajñayā
translated: O you of little understanding, an enemy, however small, should not be disregarded.

analyzed: vahniḥ alpaḥ pi asaṃhāryaḥ kurute bhasmasāt jagat
translated: Even a small fire, if not put out, reduces the world to ashes.

original: nave vayasi yaḥ śāntaḥ sa śānta iti me matiḥ /
analyzed: nave vayasi yaḥ śāntaḥ sa śāntaḥ iti me matiḥ
translated: He who is peaceful in his youth, I think, is truly peaceful.

original: dhātuṣu kṣīyamāṇeṣu śamaḥ kasya na jāyate // / / //
analyzed: dhātuṣu kṣīyamāṇeṣu śamaḥ kasya na jāyate
translated: When the elements are decaying, peace arises in everyone.

analyzed: panthānaḥ iva vipra indra sarva sādhāraṇāḥ śriyaḥ
translated: Riches, O chief of Brahmanas, are common to all like roads.

original: madīyā iti matvā vai na hi harṣayuto bhavet // / / //🔽cittāyattaṃ dhātuvaśyaṃ śarīraṃ citte naṣṭe dhātavo yānti nāśam /
analyzed: madīyāḥ iti matvā vai na hi harṣa yutaḥ bhavet  citta āyattam dhātu vaśyam śarīram citte naṣṭe dhātavaḥ yānti nāśam
translated: Thinking These are mine, one should not be full of joy.🔽The body, dependent on the mind and under the control of the elements, when the mind is destroyed, the elements are destroyed.

original: tasmāccittaṃ sarvadā rakṣaṇīyaṃ svasthe citte dhātavaḥ sambhavanti // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt cittam sarvadā rakṣaṇīyam svasthe citte dhātavaḥ sambhavanti
translated: Therefore, the mind should always be protected. When the mind is healthy, the elements exist.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe pūrvakhaṇḍe prathamāṃśākhye ācārakāṇḍe bṛhadṛ nītisāre caturdaśottaraśatatamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe pūrva khaṇḍe prathama aṃśa ākhye ācāra kāṇḍe nīti sāre caturdaśottaraśatatamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the One Hundred and Fourteenth Chapter in the Vamana Purana—114

analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: The Glorious Garuda Mahapurana

original: sūta uvāca /🔽kumāryāṃ ca kumitraṃ ca kurājānaṃ kuputrakam /
analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca  kumāryām ca ku mitram ca ku rājānam ku putrakam
translated: Suta said:🔽One should avoid a bad daughter, a bad friend, a bad king, a bad son,

original: kukanyāṃ ca kudeśaṃ ca dūrataḥ parivarjayet // / / //
analyzed: ku kanyām ca ku deśam ca dūratas parivarjayet
translated: a bad daughter, and a bad country from afar.

original: dharmaḥ pravrajitastapaḥ pracalitaṃ satyaṃ ca dūraṃ gataṃ pṛthvī vandhyaphalā janāḥ kapaṭino laulye sthitā brāhmaṇāḥ /
analyzed: dharmaḥ pravrajitaḥ tapaḥ pracalitam satyam ca dūram gatam pṛthvī vandhya phalā janāḥ kapaṭinaḥ laulye sthitāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: Dharma has renounced, austerity has moved, truth has gone far, the earth has fruitless fruits, people are deceitful, Brahmins are engaged in fickleness,

original: martyāḥ strīvaśagāḥ striyaśca capalā nīcā janā unnatāḥ hā kaṣṭaṃ khalujīvitaṃ kaliyuge dhanyā janā ye mṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: martyāḥ strī vaśa gāḥ striyaḥ ca capalāḥ nīcāḥ janāḥ unnatāḥ hā kaṣṭam khalu jīvitam kali yuge dhanyāḥ janāḥ ye mṛtāḥ
translated: men are under the control of women, women are fickle, low people are exalted - alas! indeed is life in the Kali Yuga. Blessed are those people who have died.

original: dhanyāste ye na paśyanti deśabhaṅgaṃ kulakṣayam /
analyzed: dhanyāḥ te ye na paśyanti deśa bhaṅgam kula kṣayam
translated: Blessed are those who do not witness the destruction of the country and the ruin of the family,

analyzed: para citta gatān dārān putram ku vyasane sthitam
translated: the wife who has gone to another's mind, and the son who is engaged in bad vices.

analyzed: ku putre nirvṛtiḥ nā asti ku bhāryāyām kutas ratiḥ
translated: There is no satisfaction in a bad son, how can there be pleasure in a bad wife?

original: sumitra nāsti viśvāsaḥ kurājye nāsti jīvitam // / / //
analyzed: sumitra na asti viśvāsaḥ ku rājye na asti jīvitam
translated: There is no trust in a good friend, there is no life in a bad kingdom.

original: parānnaṃ ca parasvaṃ ca paraśayyāḥ parastriyaḥ /
analyzed: para annam ca para svam ca para śayyāḥ para striyaḥ
translated: The food of others, the wealth of others, the bed of others, the wife of others,

analyzed: para veśmani vāsaḥ ca śakrāt api haret śriyam
translated: and dwelling in the house of others - these take away prosperity even from Indra.

analyzed: ālāpāt gātra saṃsparśāt saṃsargāt saha bhojanāt
translated: From conversation, from physical contact, from association, from eating together,

analyzed: āsanāt śayanāt yānāt pāpam saṃkramate nṛṇām
translated: from sitting together, from lying together, from riding together, sin passes from man to man.

original: striyo naśyanti rūpeṇa tapaḥ krodhana naśyati /
analyzed: striyaḥ naśyanti rūpeṇa tapaḥ krodhana naśyati
translated: Women perish through beauty, penance perishes through anger,

analyzed: gāvaḥ śūdra annena dvijottamaḥ
translated: cows through being taken out for grazing, and the best of Brahmins through the food of Shudras.

analyzed: āsanāt eka śayyāyām bojanāt paṅkti saṅkarāt
translated: From sitting together, from lying on the same bed, from eating together, from associating in the same row,

analyzed: tatas saṃkramate pāpam ghaṭāt dhaṭe iva udakam
translated: sin passes from one to another, like water from one pot to another.

analyzed: lālane bahavaḥ doṣāḥ tāḍane bahavaḥ guṇāḥ
translated: In fondling, there are many faults; in beating, there are many virtues.

original: tasmācchiṣyaṃ ca putraṃ ca tāḍayenna tu lālayet // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt śiṣyam ca putram ca tāḍayet na tu lālayet
translated: Therefore, one should beat one's disciple and son, but not fondle them.

original: adhvā jarā dehavatāṃ parvatānāṃ jalaṃ jarā /
analyzed: adhvā jarā dehavatām parvatānām jalam jarā
translated: Travel is the old age of embodied beings, water is the old age of mountains,

analyzed: asaṃbhogaḥ ca nārīṇām vastrāṇām ātapaḥ jarā
translated: non-enjoyment is the old age of women, and sunlight is the old age of clothes.

analyzed: adhamāḥ kalim icchanti sandhim icchati madhyamāḥ
translated: The low desire for quarrel, the middling desire for peace,

original: uttamā mānamicchanti māno hi mahatāṃ dhanam // / / //
analyzed: uttamāḥ mānam icchanti mānaḥ hi mahatām dhanam
translated: the best desire for honor, for honor is the wealth of the great.

original: māno hi mūlamarthasya māne sati dhanena kim /
analyzed: mānaḥ hi mūlam arthasya māne sati dhanena kim
translated: For pride is the root of wealth. What is the use of wealth if there is pride?

original: prabhraṣṭamānadarpasya kiṃ dhanena kimāyuṣā // / / //🔽adhamā dhanamicchanti dhanamānau hi madhyamāḥ /
analyzed: prabhraṣṭa māna darpasya kim dhanena kim āyuṣā  adhamāḥ dhanam icchanti dhana mānau hi madhyamāḥ
translated: What is the use of wealth or life for one whose pride and arrogance have been shattered?🔽The low desire for wealth, the middling for wealth and pride,

original: uttamā mānamicchanti māno hi mahatāṃ dhanam // / / //
analyzed: uttamāḥ mānam icchanti mānaḥ hi mahatām dhanam
translated: The high desire for pride, for pride is the wealth of the great.

original: vane 'pi siṃhā na namanti kaṃ ca bubhu kṣitā māṃsanirīkṣaṇaṃ ca /
analyzed: vane pi siṃhāḥ na namanti kam ca bubhu kṣitāḥ māṃsa nirīkṣaṇam ca
translated: Even in the forest, lions do not bow to anyone, and when hungry, they look for meat.

original: dhanairvihīnāḥ sukuleṣu jātā na nīcakarmāṇi samārabhante // / / //
analyzed: dhanaiḥ vihīnāḥ su kuleṣu jātāḥ na nīca karmāṇi samārabhante
translated: Even if deprived of wealth, those born in good families do not undertake base actions.

original: nābhiṣeko na saṃskāraḥ siṃhasya kriyate vane /
analyzed: na abhiṣekaḥ na saṃskāraḥ siṃhasya kriyate vane
translated: The consecration and preparation of a lion is not done in the forest.

analyzed: nityam ūrjita sattvasya svayam eva mṛgendra tā
translated: The lordship over animals is always by its own inherent strength.

original: vaṇikpramādī bhṛkaśca mānī bhikṣurvilāsī hyadhanaśca kāmī /
analyzed: vaṇij pramādī mānī bhikṣuḥ vilāsī hi adhanaḥ ca kāmī
translated: A merchant is careless, a brahmin is proud, a monk is dissipated, and a lover is poor.

original: varāṅganā cāpriyavādinī ca na te ca karmāṇi samārabhante // / / //
analyzed: vara aṅganā ca apriya vādinī ca na te ca karmāṇi samārabhante
translated: A beautiful woman speaks unpleasantly, and they do not undertake those actions.

original: dātā daridraḥ kṛpaṇor'thayuktaḥ puttro 'vidheyaḥ kujanasya sevā /
analyzed: dātā daridraḥ kṛpaṇa artha yuktaḥ puttraḥ vidheyaḥ ku janasya sevā
translated: A generous person is poor, a miser is wealthy, a son is disobedient, and service to a bad person.

original: paropakāreṣu narasya mṛtyuḥ prajāyate duścaritāni pañca // / / //
analyzed: para upakāreṣu narasya mṛtyuḥ prajāyate duścaritāni pañca
translated: For a man who helps others, death and these five misdeeds occur.

original: kāntāviyogaḥ svajanāpamānaṃ ṛṇasya śeṣaḥ kujanasya sevā /
analyzed: kāntā viyogaḥ sva jana apamānam ṛṇasya śeṣaḥ ku janasya sevā
translated: Separation from a beloved, humiliation from one's own people, the remainder of a debt, service to a bad person,

original: dāridrayābhāvādvimukhāśca mitrā vināgninā pañca dahanti tīvrāḥ // / / //
analyzed: dāridrayā abhāvāt vimukhāḥ ca mitrāḥ vinā agninā pañca dahanti tīvrāḥ
translated: and friends turning away due to poverty - these five burn intensely, as if without fire.

original: cintāsahasreṣu ca teṣu madhye cintāścatasro 'pyasidhāratulyāḥ /🔽nīcāpamānaṃ kṣudhitaṃ kalatraṃ bhāryā viraktā sahajoparodhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: cintā sahasreṣu ca teṣu madhye cintāḥ catasraḥ pi asi dhāra tulyāḥ  nīca apamānam kṣudhitam kalatram bhāryā viraktā sahaja uparodhaḥ
translated: Among those thousands of worries, there are four worries that are like the edge of a sword:🔽humiliation from inferiors, hungry wife, a wife who is detached, and natural opposition.

original: vaśyaśca purtrer'tha karī ca vidyā arogitā sajjanasaṅgatiśca /🔽iṣṭā ca bhāryā vaśavartinī ca duḥ khasya mūloddharaṇāni pañca // / / //
analyzed: vaśyaḥ ca karī ca vidyā arogi tā sat jana saṅgatiḥ ca  iṣṭā ca bhāryā vaśa vartinī ca duḥ khasya mūla uddharaṇāni pañca
translated: A controllable son, knowledge that brings wealth, good health, association with good people,🔽and a beloved wife who is under control - these five are the uprooting of the foundation of suffering.

analyzed: mīnāḥ hatāḥ pañcabiḥ eva pañca
translated: Deer, elephants, insects, birds, and fish are killed by the five only.

original: ekaḥ pramāthī sa kathaṃ na ghātyo yaḥ sevate pañcabhireva pañca // / / //
analyzed: ekaḥ pramāthī sa katham na ghātyaḥ yaḥ sevate pañcabhiḥ eva pañca
translated: How is the single destroyer, who serves the five with the five, not to be killed?

analyzed: adhīraḥ karkaśaḥ stabdhaḥ ku celaḥ svayam āgataḥ
translated: An unsteady person, a harsh person, a stiff person, a person in dirty clothes, and one who comes on his own -

original: pañca viprā na pūjyante bṛhaspatisamā api // / / //
analyzed: pañca viprāḥ na pūjyante bṛhaspati samāḥ api
translated: these five Brahmins are not to be worshipped, even if they are equal to Brihaspati.

original: āyuḥ karma ca vittaṃ ca vidyā nidhanameva ca /
analyzed: āyuḥ karma ca vittam ca vidyā nidhanam eva ca
translated: Life, deeds, wealth, knowledge, and death,

analyzed: pañca etāni vivicyante jāyamānasya dehinaḥ
translated: These five are examined of one who is being born.

analyzed: parvata ārohaṇe toye gokule duṣṭa nigrahe
translated: In climbing mountains, in water, in a cow pen, in subduing the wicked,

analyzed: patitasya samutthāne śastāḥ pañca hi ete
translated: in rising from a fall, these five are indeed praised.

analyzed: guṇāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: These are considered qualities.

analyzed: abhra chāyā khale prītiḥ para nārīṣu saṃgatiḥ
translated: The shadow of a cloud, friendship with a rogue, association with the wives of others,

original: pañcaite hyasthirā bhāvā yauvanāni dhanāni ca // / / //
analyzed: pañca ete hi asthirāḥ bhāvāḥ yauvanāni dhanāni ca
translated: these five are unstable, like youth and wealth.

analyzed: asthiram jīvitam loke asthiram dhana yauvanam
translated: Life in the world is unstable, wealth and youth are unstable,

analyzed: asthiram puttra dāra ādyam dharmaḥ kīrtiḥ yaśaḥ sthiram
translated: sons, wife, and so on are unstable, but dharma, fame, and glory are stable.

analyzed: jīvitam ati alpam rātriḥ tasya ardha hāriṇī
translated: Life is very short, a hundred years; half of that is taken away by night,

analyzed: vyādhi śoka jarā āyāsaiḥ ardham tat api niṣphalam
translated: and half of that is also fruitless due to illness, sorrow, old age, and toil.

original: āyurvarṣaśataṃ nṛṇāṃ parimitaṃ rātrau tadardhaṃ gataṃ tasyārdhasthitakiñcidardhamadhikaṃ bālyasya kāle gatam /
analyzed: āyuḥ varṣa śatam nṛṇām parimitam rātrau tad ardham gatam tasya ardha sthita kiñcid ardham adhikam bālyasya kāle gatam
translated: Human life is limited to a hundred years, half of that is spent in night, a little more than half of that is spent in childhood,

original: kiñcidvandhuviyogaduḥ khamaraṇairbhūpālasevāgataṃ śeṣaṃ vāritaraṅgagarbhacapalaṃ mānena kiṃ māninām // / / //
analyzed: kiñcid vandhu viyoga duḥ kha maraṇaiḥ bhūpāla sevā gatam śeṣam vāri taraṅga garbha capalam mānena kim māninām
translated: and some is spent in separation from loved ones, sorrow, death, and service to the king. The rest is as fickle as the waves in the ocean. What is the use of pride for the proud?

analyzed: ahorātra mayaḥ loke jarā rūpeṇa saṃcaret
translated: Death moves in the world in the form of old age, day and night,

analyzed: mṛtyuḥ grasati bhūtāni pavanam pannagaḥ yathā
translated: devouring beings like a snake swallowing air.

original: gacchatastiṣṭhato vāpi jāgrataḥ svapato na cet /
analyzed: gacchataḥ tiṣṭhataḥ vā api jāgrataḥ svapataḥ na ced
translated: Whether one is going or standing, awake or asleep,

analyzed: sarva sattva hita arthāya paśoḥ iva viceṣṭitam
translated: if one does not act for the welfare of all beings,🔽like an animal, what is the difference between such a man and an animal?

analyzed: ahita hita vicāra śūnya buddheḥ śruti samaye bahubhiḥ vitarkitasya
translated: For one whose intellect is devoid of consideration of what is harmful or beneficial, who is full of doubts at the time of hearing,

analyzed: udara bharaṇa mātra tuṣṭa buddheḥ puruṣa paśoḥ ca paśoḥ ca kaḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: whose intellect is content with merely filling the stomach, what is the difference between such a man and an animal?

original: śaurye tapasi dāne ca yasya na prathitaṃ yaśaḥ /
analyzed: śaurye tapasi dāne ca yasya na prathitam yaśaḥ
translated: For one whose fame is not spread in heroism, austerity, and charity,

original: vidyāyāmarthalābhe vā māturuccāra eva saḥ // / / //🔽yajjīvyate kṣaṇamapi prathitaṃ manuṣyairvijñānavikramayaśobhirabhagnamānaiḥ /
analyzed: vidyāyām artha lābhe vā mātuḥ uccāre eva saḥ  yat jīvyate kṣaṇam api prathitam manuṣyaiḥ vijñāna vikrama yaśobhiḥ abhagna mānaiḥ
translated: in learning or in acquiring wealth, his birth is just like the discharge of urine.🔽If one lives for a moment, renowned among men, with unbroken pride in knowledge, valor, and fame,

original: tannāma jīvitamiti pravadanti tajjñāḥ kāko 'pi jīvati ciraṃ ca baliṃ ca bhuṅkte // / / //
analyzed: tat nāma jīvitam iti pravadanti tad jñāḥ jīvati ciram ca balim ca bhuṅkte
translated: the wise say that is true life. Even a crow lives long and eats offerings.

original: kiṃ jīvitena dhanamānavivarjitena mitreṇa kiṃ bhavati bhītisaśaṅkitena /
analyzed: kim jīvitena dhana māna vivarjitena mitreṇa kim bhavati bhīti sa śaṅkitena
translated: What is the use of life devoid of wealth and honor? What is the use of a friend who is fearful and suspicious?

original: siṃhavrataṃ carata gacchata mā viṣādaṃ kāko 'pi jīvati ciraṃ ca baliṃ ca bhuṅkte // / / //
analyzed: siṃha vratam carata gacchata mā viṣādam kākaḥ pi jīvati ciram ca balim ca bhuṅkte
translated: Practise the lion's vow, go on, do not despair. Even a crow lives long and gets food.

original: yo vātmanīha na gurau na ca bhṛtyavarge dīne dayāṃ na kurute na ca mitrakārye /
analyzed: yaḥ vā ātmani iha na gurau na ca bhṛtya varge dīne dayām na kurute na ca mitra kārye
translated: He who does not show compassion to himself, to his guru, to his servants, to the poor, and does not do his friend's work,

original: kiṃ tasya jīvitaphalenamanuṣyaloke kāko 'pi jīvati ciraṃ ca baliṃ ca bhuṅkte // / / //
analyzed: kim tasya jīvita phalena manuṣya loke jīvati ciram ca balim ca bhuṅkte
translated: What is the use of his life in the human world? Even a crow lives long and gets food.

analyzed: yasya trivarga śūnyāni dināni āyānti yānti ca
translated: He whose days come and go devoid of the three goals,

analyzed: sa lauhakāra bhastrā iva śvasan api na jīvati
translated: He lives like an iron bellows, though breathing, he does not live.

analyzed: svādhīna vṛtteḥ sāphalyam na para adhīna varti tā
translated: The success of one who acts independently is not that of one who acts under the control of others.

original: ye parādhīnakarmāṇo jīvanto 'pi ca te mṛtāḥ // / / //🔽susva pūrā vai kāpuruṣāḥ susva
analyzed: ye para adhīna karmāṇaḥ jīvantaḥ ca te mṛtāḥ  susva pūrāḥ vai kāpuruṣāḥ susva
translated: Those whose actions are under the control of others, though living, are as good as dead.

analyzed: pūraḥ mūṣika añjaliḥ
translated: The belly is full of bad men, the belly is a fist of mice.

analyzed: asantuṣṭaḥ kāpuruṣaḥ su alpakena api tuṣyati
translated: An unfulfilled man is satisfied even with a little.

analyzed: abhra chāyā tṛṇāt agniḥ nocasevā pathaḥ jalam
translated: The shadow of a cloud, fire from grass, service of a prostitute, water on the road,

analyzed: veśyā rāgaḥ khale prītiḥ ṣaṭ ete budvuda upamāḥ
translated: Attachment to a prostitute, friendship with a rogue - these six are like bubbles.

original: vācā vihitasārthena loko na ca sukhāyate /
analyzed: vācā vihita sārthena lokaḥ na ca sukhāyate
translated: The world is not happy with words of meaning.

original: jīvitaṃ mānamūlaṃ hi māne mlāne kutaḥ sukham / // / / //
analyzed: jīvitam māna mūlam hi māne mlāne kutas sukham
translated: Life is rooted in honor; when honor is lost, where is happiness?
